overview: The characters of Looney Tunes are all babies and live with Granny.

episodes.title: Eggs-traordinary Adventure
episodes.description: The day before Easter, Granny reads the story of the Easter Bunny to her young Looney Tunes charges with predictable reactions: cynic Daffy scoffs at the notion; Sylvester, Tweety, Taz, and Lola are entranced; and Bugs is on the fence. A prolonged argument ensues, and during naptime the four youngest sneak out to search for the egg-bearing bunny. Thoughtful Bugs paints rocks to placate the younger ones, but on Easter morning all is well when the real Easter rabbit delivers the goodies. This hour-long movie is loaded with cheery songs, pastel colors, and a surprising number of teaching moments. With the exception of the ornery Daffy, this little band really watches out for one another.

episodes.title: Song: Mary Had a Baby Duck
Song: Does Your Tongue Hang Low
Song: If You're Looney and You Know It
Song: Foghorn's Talkin' in the Barnyard
Song: Baby Elmer Had a Friend
Song: John Jacob Jingle Elmer Fudd
Song: Ten Loonies in a Bed
Song: My Bunny Lies Over the Ocean
Song: Oh Where, Oh Where Has My Baby Martian Gone?
Song: The Hare Hid Under the Fountain
Song: He'll Be Zooming Around the Mountain
Song: Pepe Le Pew Le Skunk
Taz in Toyland
episodes.description: When Taz keeps breaking most of his toys, Granny gives him a new one. When he thinks he broke it Granny says thats the toys job.

episodes.title: A Secret Tweet
episodes.description: Granny plans a surprised birthday party for Tweety. Tweety thinks everybody doesn't like him then he searches for the answer.

episodes.title: Comfort Level
episodes.description: Sylvester looses his blanket and the gang helps him look for it.

episodes.title: Like a Duck to Water
episodes.description: Granny gives the babies a swimmimg lesson. Daffy is afraid to swim because the pool is to big.

episodes.title: School Daze
episodes.description: The babies want to go to school but granny doesn't let them. So then they decide to play school at home and they practice things such as: going on the bus, crossing the street, fire drills, and other things.

episodes.title: Things That Go Bugs in the Night
episodes.description: The babies are startled when they hear noises in the nite and learn that hings are not always as the appear or sound.

episodes.title: The Creature from the Chocolate Chip
episodes.description: Sylvester eats all of Grannys cookies and when he realizes what he did he asks the babies for help to make up a cookie eating monster to blame.

episodes.title: Card Bored Box
episodes.description: When it rains, the babies make use out of a box to play with.

episodes.title: Time and Time Again
episodes.description: Granny gives the babies lesons on how to tell time. Daffy thinks he doesn't need a lesson and skips it.

episodes.title: May the Best Taz Win
episodes.description: Bugs & Daffy fight over who gets Lola on there team to play tennis. Lola chooses Bugs team and Daffy is stuck with Taz on his team.

episodes.title: Mine!
episodes.description: Daffy learns a lesson when he finds a purse filled with money.

episodes.title: Sylvester the Pester
episodes.description: An attention starved Sylvester wont let Granny have any time to herself.

episodes.title: Cat-Taz-Trophy
episodes.description: The babies play race cars to win a cookie trophy prize. Taz & Sylvester win the race.

episodes.title: Duck! Monster! Duck!
episodes.description: Daffy tells the babies a scary story. When they go to bed he starts scaring all of them.

episodes.title: The Brave Little Tweety
episodes.description: The babies make Tweety brave so he won't be so scared at things.

episodes.title: The Puddle Olympics
episodes.description: The babies take turns jumping over a puddle, but it turns out Sylvester is afraid of water.

episodes.title: A Lot Like Lola
episodes.description: Lola wants everyone to be like her. But when they act like her, she gets mad.

episodes.title: Mother's Day Madness
episodes.description: The babies compete to see who can make the best mothers day card.

episodes.title: Takers Keepers
episodes.description: Daffy steals Taz's favorite toy. But he soon learns a lesson that he can't take everything he wants.

episodes.title: To Tell the Tooth
episodes.description: When Bugs looses a tooth, Daffy tries to figure out a way to scam the Tooth Fairy.

episodes.title: Spinout
episodes.description: Taz loses his ability to spin and the babies help him learn again.

episodes.title: Snow Day
episodes.description: The babies experience their first snowfall.

episodes.title: Shadow of a Doubt
episodes.description: Tweety sheds some light on what a shadow is.

episodes.title: Christmas in July
episodes.description: The babies pretend its Christmas so Lola will get the stethoscope she wants.

episodes.title: Bruce Bunny
episodes.description: When Daffy makes up hurtful rhymes, Bugs changes his name to Bruce.

episodes.title: Leader of the Pack
episodes.description: Daffy starts a secret password club for everyone except Bugs.

episodes.title: Flower Power
episodes.description: The babies all want to pick the best flowers for Granny, but end up destroying her garden.

episodes.title: Lightning Bugs Sylvester
episodes.description: Sylvester learns to overcome his fear of lightning.

episodes.title: Flush Hour
episodes.description: The babies are afraid of the toilet, and don't know what it's for until they flood it and soon find out that it's an alternative to diapers.

episodes.title: I Strain
episodes.description: Petunia can't stop watching TV.

episodes.title: The Sandman Is Coming
episodes.description: Granny tells the babies about the Sandman coming and putting the sand in their eyes while sleeping. Daffy gets scared and stays up all night.

episodes.title: Some Assembly Required
episodes.description: Bugs orders a toy but he has to put it together and he can't. So the babies help him.

episodes.title: All Washed Up
episodes.description: When Granny asks the babies to take a bath, Taz doesn't want to. So the babies try to make Taz take a bath so they can have play time.

episodes.title: Did Not! Did Too!
episodes.description: Frustrated that more of the Baby Looney Tunes regard Baby Bugs as the leader than her, Baby Lola challenges Baby Bugs to a winner-take-all match. At stake is leadership of the group!  Two strong personalities end up working together rather than in conflict.

episodes.title: Tea & Basketball
episodes.description: Sylvester wants to play Tea Party and Lola wants to play Basketball with the boys but neither of them can't because Tea parties are for girls and Basketball is for boys. So Sylvester fakes an injury for him to play tea party and Lola to play basketball.

episodes.title: Taz You Like It
episodes.description: When no one wants to play with Taz, he starts faking accidents like falling down to make the babies like him and spend time with him.

episodes.title: Band Together
episodes.description: The babies hear Granny play her favourite music so they form a symphony.

episodes.title: War of the Weirds
episodes.description: Marvin the Martian pays a visit to the babies, but no one likes him so Taz befriends Marvin to make him feel welcome. Then everyone else feels the same.

episodes.title: The Harder They Fall
episodes.description: The babies all want to do roller skating except Bugs, who feels embarrassed about his lack of talent, but gives it a shot when Tweety goes sliding down.

episodes.title: Business as Unusual
episodes.description: When Daffy sees Bugs establish his own lemonade stand, he becomes his partner but doesn't do his fair share of work, so Daffy competes with his own stand.

episodes.title: Mr. McStuffles
episodes.description: Daffy tries to keep his old Mr. McStuffles and yet never plays with it and would rather play with something better.

episodes.title: Picture This!
episodes.description: In a fairy tale, pages of the book are missing, so the babies decide to recreate the pages of the story with drawings, Daffy, Tweety and Sylvester going a little off point.

episodes.title: Hair Cut-Ups
episodes.description: With Lola's hair getting in her eyes, Melissa attends to it with hair gel only for Lola to get laughed at. Granny arranges for a hairdressing appointment but Lola has second thoughts about it, until Granny coaxes her.

episodes.title: A Clean Sweep
episodes.description: Everyone cleans up after themselves before nap time except for lazy Daffy. Daffy's biggest mess puts his and the others' visit to the park at stake.

episodes.title: Daffy Did It!
episodes.description: Tweety puts the blame on Daffy for every single incident caused by his antics. However Daffy's situation is more than it would seem.

episodes.title: Pig Who Cried Wolf
episodes.description: With no one but imaginary friends attending her tea parties, Petunia attracts the others attention with false alarms. She regrets this after the sink starts overflowing.

episodes.title: New Cat in Town
episodes.description: Sylvester gets envious when his attention for being cute is replaced by Baby Pepe, but he comes to like him after Pepe shows affection for him.

episodes.title: Magic of Spring
episodes.description: After Bugs' attempt to do magic tricks fails, he wanders into the countryside to view and experience the beauty of springtime, inspiring him to try again with his magic show.

episodes.title: Who Said That?
episodes.description: Daffy learns a bad word from the garbage man and later uses it when he gets angry. He teaches it to his friends, and they use it on Granny. Surprised, she confronts Daffy and shows him effective ways to control his anger.

episodes.title: Let Them Make Cake
episodes.description: Everybody wants to help Granny make a cake except Melissa who just wants to just eat it. Although Melissa misses out on the cake, she joins the others to make another one.

episodes.title: For Whom the Toll Calls
episodes.description: Feeling left out, Petunia and Tweety decide to call Granny's sister Auntie, but instead they call a long distance number, so Granny gives them walkie talkies to play with.

episodes.title: Cereal Boxing
episodes.description: The babies become obsessed eating boxes of cereal and gaining prizes when Sylvester receives his. They continue their eating until they get stomach aches. Lacking in cereal the babies eat oatmeal porridge the following morning.

episodes.title: Mind Your Manners
episodes.description: The babies practice some table manners to go on trip to a smart restaurant with Granny. Instead they make a mess. After cleaning up, Granny gives them lessons in preparation for the trip.

episodes.title: Pastime for Petunia
episodes.description: Melissa tries to find something for Petunia that she's good at. Although her attempts to play well fail, the others discover she is good at helpful assistance.

episodes.title: Pouting Match
episodes.description: Lola gets in the habit of pouting when she doesn't get her way. Fed up with her bratiness, the others mimic her pouting expressions, but begin to use them against each other, until Granny tells Lola about taking turns.

episodes.title: Wise Quacker
episodes.description: Melissa picks up an idea from TV and begins cracking jokes at her friends, eventually upsetting Lola. After a talk with Granny, Melissa makes it up to her friends with comical speech.

episodes.title: Yours, Mine...and Mine, Mine!
episodes.description: Daffy believes he'll get some new toys in exchange for giving his old ones away not realizing what is in store for sharing his stuff.

episodes.title: Loose Change
episodes.description: Sylvester becomes afraid of new changes as the babies and Granny try to widen variety and has no wish to join in the fun, until Granny shows Sylvester what he's missing.

episodes.title: Act Your Age
episodes.description: Sylvester, Bugs and Daffy all try to hog attention for Granny. To sort this out, Granny treats the three like they're younger than the others, prompting them to change.

episodes.title: Who's Your Granny?
episodes.description: While Granny is recovering from a foot bunion, Lola takes charge. The babies soon get tired of Lola's decision making and they tire her out.

episodes.title: Tattletale
episodes.description: Thinking it's the right thing, Lola tells on her friends for any misbehaviour. In response to her telltale antics, the babies refuse to play with her, but Lola settles the matter with an apology.

episodes.title: The Yolk's On You
episodes.description: Daffy and Melissa stick together to play impractical jokes on the others. To get even, Lola demonstrates the consequences of an impractical joke to Daffy and Melissa.

episodes.title: Baby Gate
episodes.description: Melissa gossips tales of Taz to the others, whilst Bugs has doubts and tries to prove they aren't true. After proving Melissa wrong, she confesses her fibs.

episodes.title: Never Say Try
episodes.description: After failed attempts of flying a kite, blowing bubblegum and dancing, Sylvester is inclined to give up new activities altogether, until the others trick him into trying finger painting.

episodes.title: Pair O' Dice Lost
episodes.description: Daffy spoils everyone elses fun since he can't keep up with them and Bugs points out Daffy cannot even finish a single task. Granny rewards Daffy in return for trying to the finish even when things can't always go the way he wants them.

episodes.title: Melissa the Hero
episodes.description: After helping Petunia's doll, Melissa brags on about being heroic by making up parts of what actually happened, annoying Petunia. However Melissa is in a tight spot when she has retell the story to everyone.

episodes.title: Trouble with Larry
episodes.description: Because Petunia feels too shy to decline a game with her friends, she invents an imaginary friend called Larry, which makes the others nervous. They invent their own imaginary friends to snap Petunia out of it.

episodes.title: The Littlest Tweety
episodes.description: Tweety feels distressed from being pushed around and overlooked because of his small size, but everyone else starts to regret it after they can't manage without him.

episodes.title: In Bugs We Trust
episodes.description: Everyone goes along with Bugs' decisions until he is entrusted to buy a new net for everyone, when his greed gets the better of him and he disappoints them with toys he wanted for himself. He makes up for this by giving up one of his best toys for the necessary money.

episodes.title: Cool for Cats
episodes.description: Sylvester believes he lacks coolness and thinks he can get it by eating Chewy Chomps he saw on a commercial, but all it does is make his breath stink.

episodes.title: Time Out!
episodes.description: After misbehaving, Granny gives Taz, Daffy and Bugs a time out. Each time the three try to make up for it, their discipline is extended.

episodes.title: Present Tense
episodes.description: Today is Arbor day and everyone wants to give Granny something special, but Lola wants do that by herself. When the others see the trouble Lola is having, they give her a helping hand.

episodes.title: The Neat and the Sloppy
episodes.description: Daffy spreads a muddy mess around the house horrifying the tidy Sylvester. Bugs manages to snap Sylvester out of his mania for cleanliness, leaving Daffy to clean his own mess.

episodes.title: Tell-a-Photo
episodes.description: Granny shows to the babies a photo album and they reminisce their past times together.

episodes.title: Move It!
episodes.description: The babies overhear what they assume is that Granny is moving to a new house and they reminisce the times they enjoyed inside the house. It is revealed that all Granny wants to move around and not move to a new house.

episodes.title: These Little Piggies Went To Market
episodes.description: The babies are going with Floyd to help with the shopping at the supermarket. They go crazy over their favourite foods and mess up the place, even Bugs.

episodes.title: Now Museum, Now You Don't
episodes.description: The babies are going with Floyd to the art museum. Everyone save Daffy is fascinated by the artworks a lot more than Floyd expected and Daffy picks up his own interest

episodes.title: Take Us Out to the Ballgame
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies to the stadium to watch the baseball game, supporting the Roosters Team. The tables turn for the Roosters when Wingouski does a home run.

episodes.title: Clues Encounters of the Tweety Kind
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies to the museum for a scavenger hunt, Sylvester's team competing against Daffy team and Tweety as a neutral friend wins the hunt.

episodes.title: A Bully for Bugs
episodes.description: Bugs is taken advantage of by Elmer Fudd and is too afraid to tell. The babies resort to befriending instead of payback.

episodes.title: The Wheel Deal
episodes.description: The babies go out bike riding while Tweety rides with Floyd not amused from the lack of fun until the others customise a bike for him.

episodes.title: Oh Brother, Warehouse Art Thou
episodes.description: After Daffy accidentally breaks Granny's chair, Floyd takes everyone to buy a new one, while Sylvester protests the idea of replacing it until the others show him how to stick with what's coming.

episodes.title: Flu the Coop
episodes.description: Granny takes the babies to the hospital for their flu shots, but Bugs and Daffy manage to elude their turn for a shot. In getting ill, Bugs and Daffy miss all the fun the others have. (Not to be confused with a Kid vs Kat episode of the same name)

episodes.title: Blast Off Bugs
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies to the museum, whilst Bugs dream on flying to the moon is shattered until, Taz gets them all tangled in the space experience zone.

episodes.title: Baby Brouhaha
episodes.description: Bugs thinks Granny is having a baby and the others are convinced by Daffy's make-believe theory on where babies come from and a guidebook on baby care. As everyone prepares by practicing on Tweety, the baby turns out to be a hamster.

episodes.title: Log Cabin Fever
episodes.description: With the babies squabbling over gadgets, Granny decides to take them to a 17th Century farm, where everything is done manually. However Bugs and Daffy are sneakily playing a game pod until they break it.

episodes.title: A Mid-Autumn Night's Scream
episodes.description: The babies dress up for Halloween, while Lola, Melissa and Petunia end up with ridiculous costumes. Three Martian Birds accompany them on their trick or treating while Sylvester braves Hilltop Manor. The three girls win in the costume contest for originality.

episodes.title: Are We There, Yet
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies on a long journey to the Acme Garlic Festival. All the while they try to pass the time giving Floyd a tiresome time. Floyd's car breaks down and they miss the festival but they get some garlic souvenirs.

episodes.title: Save Our Cinnamon
episodes.description: Floyd take the babies to Auntie's Bakery, where they love cinnamon rolls, but unfortunately the bakery's business is due to close down. Everyone works hard to get the bakery in the book of world records so that its left standing.

episodes.title: Lights! Camera! Tweety!
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies to the TV Studio, guided the star Tessa. When Tessa gets locked outside the building, the babies decide to put on the show for her. As they get tangled on stage, Tweety takes over.

episodes.title: Backstage Bugs
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies to the Wormies Band concert. Whilst everyone is stalling Floyd, Bugs sneaks up to the backstage getting scared, but he rejoins the others and meets the star Willy Worm himself.

episodes.title: Bend it Like Petunia
episodes.description: Floyd introduces the babies to a game of soccer, Daffy under the impression girls can't play it and Petunia and Taz with a better sportsmanship than the others. Petunia manages to score the game to a draw.

episodes.title: Cock-A-Doodle-Doo-It!
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies to a farm. Tweety is met by a depressed Foghorn who is mocked by all the other roosters for his difference. The babies help him to gain spirit and courage and he befriends both Barnyard Dawg and the other roosters.

episodes.title: Wrong!
episodes.description: The babies go with Floyd to pick apples. Melissa lectures the others on correctly picking the apples which annoys them, although she can't understand their reaction. Everyone shows their methods are not wrong but different.

episodes.title: Win, Lose or Daffy
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies to a mini-golf course. Finding himself without a chance of winning, Daffy cheats, whilst Tweety scores down the hole every time. Daffy realises the game lies more in the fun than the winning score.

episodes.title: A Turtle Named Myrtle
episodes.description: On a day at the beach, Melissa gets frustrated that she can't have a new spade and makes friends with a baby turtle she calls Myrtle. Melissa wants to keep her, but learns she can't take her from her natural habitat.

episodes.title: There's Nothing Like A Good Book
episodes.description: Bugs, Daffy and Lola argue what the material of the moon is. Floyd takes them and Taz to the library for research. They find hard to refrain from making noise, but they manage to find the information they were looking for.

episodes.title: The Dolly Vanishes
episodes.description: Granny takes the babies on a train to travel to Floyd's college. When Lola loses her doll Edna, she interrogates the others for their stories. Floyd reveals Edna has half shut in the train window.

episodes.title: Duck Reflucks
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies to the green screen for their picture to be taken. Daffy, disappointed at the choice of scene, spoils Bugs' appearances on the green screen until the photographer gets his priorities right.

episodes.title: Stop and Smell Up The Flowers
episodes.description: Pepe tours the babies around the Acme gardens finding a place to plant a lemon tree. Eventually everyone gets irritated by Pepe's stink, upsetting him, but they rejoin him and he introduces them to his pal Gossamer.

episodes.title: Firehouse Frolics
episodes.description: Floyd takes the babies to the fire station where Captain Frank tutors them on safety procedures, but Daffy won't follow the rules. However Daffy's morale in the situation of a fire is higher than all the others.
